poem:
A Female Presence  

In the flickering light of screens,  
a Black president strides,  
reflecting fiction in reality's glass.  
Viola, a voice among jarring noise,  
navigates power's turbulent sea.  
Beyond Hollywood's fashioned tales,  
a truth reaches out,  
her echo, the soft urgency of change.  
In each viewer's heart,  
acrid air begins to clear.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "G20 review – Viola Davis plays president in so-so action thriller Released just three months after the inauguration, geopolitical action thriller G20 was always going to have unavoidable resonance. While the shoot ended back in March last year, there must have been points during the post-production process when those involved wondered if their film – a rousing story of a Black female president taking charge – would coincide with a similar, albeit less schlocky, real". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
